project.name: 6-DoF Robot Arm
project.description: 3D-printed 6-DoF robot arm with ESP32 + SimpleFOC motor control (Phase 1) and Raspberry Pi vision-based autonomous tracking (Phase 2).

sprints.name: Sprint 1 — CAD & Joint Design
sprints.goal: Complete parametric CAD model of all 6 joints, base plate, and bearing housings

sprints.name: Sprint 2 — Electronics & First Motor
sprints.goal: Power system assembled, drivers wired, encoders mounted, single motor spinning open-loop, parts printed

sprints.name: Sprint 3 — Closed-Loop Single Motor
sprints.goal: PID-tuned closed-loop angle control on one motor, current sensing, wiring harness complete

sprints.name: Sprint 4 — Multi-Motor + Serial CLI
sprints.goal: All 6 motors closed-loop at ≥1kHz, joint limits, E-stop, serial command interface

sprints.name: Sprint 5 — Web UI & Homing
sprints.goal: ESP32 web dashboard with sliders, homing sequence, status monitoring

sprints.name: Sprint 6 — Teach Mode & Integration Test
sprints.goal: Record/replay poses, Bluetooth gamepad, full integration test checklist passed

sprints.name: Sprint 7 — MVP Ship
sprints.goal: Payload tested, GitHub repo published with full docs, MVP demo video

sprints.name: Sprint 8 — RPi + Camera Bringup
sprints.goal: UART protocol between RPi↔ESP32, RPi OS image, ArduCam streaming 200 FPS

sprints.name: Sprint 9 — Vision Pipeline & FK
sprints.goal: Camera calibrated, HSV color tracking at 100+ FPS, DH parameters validated, camera mount printed

sprints.name: Sprint 10 — IK Solver & Trajectory
sprints.goal: Full 6-DoF IK solver under 1ms, 3D position estimation, joint-space trajectory interpolation

sprints.name: Sprint 11 — Cartesian Paths & Workspace
sprints.goal: Straight-line Cartesian paths, singularity handling, reachable workspace visualization

sprints.name: Sprint 12 — Real-Time Tracking
sprints.goal: 30Hz vision→IK→command loop with Kalman filter, self-collision checking

sprints.name: Sprint 13 — Autonomous Demo
sprints.goal: Pick-and-place demo at ≥70% success, dashboard v2 with live camera overlay

sprints.name: Sprint 14 — Metrics & Documentation
sprints.goal: Performance logging, analysis notebook, demo video, full system documentation

epics.title: Mechanical Design & 3D Printing
epics.description: Design, print, and assemble all structural components of the 6-DoF arm using BambuLab printer.

stories.title: Parametric CAD model of all 6 joints
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a parametric CAD model of all 6 joints so that I can iterate on dimensions quickly.

stories.title: Bearing housings and shaft couplers for iPower GM4108
stories.description: As an engineer, I want bearing housings and shaft couplers designed for iPower GM4108 motors so that shafts are rigid and concentric.

stories.title: Stable base plate with mounting holes
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a stable base plate with mounting holes so the arm doesn't tip during operation.

stories.title: Modular end-effector mount
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a modular end-effector mount so I can swap grippers or tool heads later.

stories.title: Optimized print orientation for all parts
stories.description: As an engineer, I want all parts printed on BambuLab with optimized orientation so that layer lines don't weaken critical joints.
acceptance_criteria: Critical joints printed flat or with inserts

stories.title: Assembly guide with hardware BOM
stories.description: As an engineer, I want an assembly guide with hardware BOM so that anyone can reproduce the build.

epics.title: Electronics & Wiring
epics.description: Design and assemble the power system, motor drivers, encoders, and wiring harness.

stories.title: Power distribution board for all motors + ESP32
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a power distribution board that supplies 12V to all 6 motors and 3.3V to the ESP32 so that the system runs from a single PSU.

stories.title: Current sensing on Joint 1 and Joint 2
stories.description: As an engineer, I want current sensing on at least Joint 1 and Joint 2 so I can detect stalls and overloads.

stories.title: SimpleFOC-compatible drivers for all 6 motors
stories.description: As an engineer, I want each motor connected to a SimpleFOC-compatible driver (e.g., SimpleFOC Shield or custom DRV8302) so that FOC runs at >=10kHz PWM.
acceptance_criteria: Heat sinks on FETs if needed

stories.title: Magnetic encoders on each joint
stories.description: As an engineer, I want magnetic encoders (AS5048A/AS5600) on each joint so that SimpleFOC has closed-loop position feedback.
acceptance_criteria: SPI or I2C bus verified (no address conflicts)

stories.title: Cable routing plan with strain relief
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a cable routing plan with strain relief so that wires don't snag or fatigue during arm motion.

epics.title: Motor Control (SimpleFOC + ESP32)
epics.description: Bring up SimpleFOC on ESP32: single motor, multi-motor, PID tuning, safety, and homing.

stories.title: Open-loop voltage mode on single motor
stories.description: As an engineer, I want to spin a single iPower motor in open-loop voltage mode via SimpleFOC so that I verify driver + encoder wiring.

stories.title: Closed-loop angle control with PID tuning
stories.description: As an engineer, I want closed-loop angle control on a single motor with PID tuning so that I can hold a setpoint within ±0.5 degrees.

stories.title: 6 motors closed-loop simultaneously at >= 1kHz
stories.description: As an engineer, I want all 6 motors running closed-loop simultaneously on a single ESP32 so that the control loop stays above 1kHz.
acceptance_criteria: If needed, dual-ESP32 with CAN bus

stories.title: Software joint limits (min/max angle)
stories.description: As an engineer, I want software joint limits (min/max angle per joint) so the arm can't self-collide or over-extend.
acceptance_criteria: Configurable min/max per joint in code

stories.title: Homing sequence with limit switches or index pulses
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a homing sequence using limit switches or index pulses so that absolute position is known after power-on.
acceptance_criteria: Each joint homes to a known zero
Homing speed is slow and safe

stories.title: Emergency stop (hardware button + software watchdog)
stories.description: As an engineer, I want an emergency stop (hardware button + software watchdog) so the arm can be killed instantly.
acceptance_criteria: Physical E-stop button cuts motor power
Software watchdog triggers if loop stalls > 50ms
Watchdog logs fault reason to serial

epics.title: Manual Joint Setpoint Interface
epics.description: User-facing interfaces for manual joint control: serial CLI, web dashboard, and gamepad.

stories.title: Serial command interface for joint angles
stories.description: As a user, I want to send target angles via serial commands (e.g., 'J1 45.0') so I can control each joint from a terminal.

stories.title: STATUS command for all joint angles and currents
stories.description: As a user, I want a 'STATUS' command that prints all 6 joint angles and motor currents so I can monitor the arm state.
acceptance_criteria: Updates at <= 100ms if in stream mode

stories.title: ESP32-hosted web UI with 6 sliders
stories.description: As a user, I want a simple web UI hosted on the ESP32 (WebSocket) with 6 sliders so I can move joints without a terminal.
acceptance_criteria: ESP32 serves HTML page via WiFi AP

stories.title: Save and replay joint poses (teach mode)
stories.description: As a user, I want to save and replay joint poses (teach mode) so I can record a sequence and play it back.

stories.title: Bluetooth gamepad control for joint jogging
stories.description: As a user, I want to control the arm with a Bluetooth gamepad so I can jog joints intuitively.
acceptance_criteria: ESP32 BLE pairs with standard gamepad
Stick axes map to joint velocity

epics.title: MVP Integration & Testing
epics.description: End-to-end integration testing, payload characterization, and documentation for MVP release.

stories.title: Full integration test checklist
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a full integration test checklist so I can verify the assembled arm meets MVP criteria.
acceptance_criteria: All 6 joints move to commanded angles

stories.title: Max payload measurement at various extensions
stories.description: As an engineer, I want to measure the max payload at full extension so I can spec the arm for real tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Motor current vs. load curve plotted

stories.title: GitHub repo with wiring diagrams, CAD, firmware, and setup guide
stories.description: As a contributor, I want a GitHub repo with wiring diagrams, CAD files, firmware, and setup instructions so others can replicate the build.

epics.title: Raspberry Pi Integration
epics.description: Establish reliable high-speed communication between Raspberry Pi and ESP32, and set up RPi environment.

stories.title: Serial protocol for >= 100Hz joint commands
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a serial (UART) or USB protocol between RPi and ESP32 so the Pi can send joint commands at >= 100Hz.

stories.title: Joint state streaming from ESP32 to RPi
stories.description: As an engineer, I want the ESP32 to stream joint states back to the RPi so the IK solver has real-time feedback.

stories.title: Reproducible RPi image with all dependencies
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a reproducible RPi image (Raspberry Pi OS Lite + deps) so any team member can flash and run.

epics.title: Camera & Vision System
epics.description: Set up high-speed camera, calibrate, implement color tracking, and estimate 3D target position.

stories.title: ArduCam streaming at 200 FPS
stories.description: As an engineer, I want the ArduCam configured to stream 200 FPS at a usable resolution (>= 320x240) so the vision pipeline has fast frames.
acceptance_criteria: CSI or USB3 connection to RPi

stories.title: Intrinsic camera calibration (checkerboard)
stories.description: As an engineer, I want intrinsic camera calibration (checkerboard method) so pixel coordinates map accurately to world coordinates.
acceptance_criteria: Calibration matrix and distortion coefficients saved

stories.title: Real-time HSV color-based object detection at >= 100 FPS
stories.description: As a user, I want real-time color-based object detection (HSV thresholding) so the arm can track a colored ball at >= 100 FPS.
acceptance_criteria: HSV range configurable via UI or config file

stories.title: Mono 3D position estimation from known object size
stories.description: As an engineer, I want to estimate the 3D position of the tracked object from a single camera using known object size so the IK solver gets XYZ targets.
acceptance_criteria: Mono depth estimation from known object diameter
Output: (X, Y, Z) in arm base frame

stories.title: 3D-printed camera mount with known transform to arm base
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a 3D-printed camera mount with known transform to the arm base so hand-eye calibration is repeatable.
acceptance_criteria: Known (X, Y, Z, R, P, Y) offset to base

epics.title: Inverse Kinematics Engine
epics.description: Implement forward kinematics, IK solver, and workspace analysis for the 6-DoF arm.

stories.title: Forward kinematics validated against CAD model
stories.description: As an engineer, I want forward kinematics (DH parameter table) validated against the CAD model so FK matches physical geometry within 1mm.
acceptance_criteria: DH table for all 6 joints documented
FK output vs. CAD measurement < 1mm error

stories.title: 6-DoF IK solver under 1ms solve time
stories.description: As an engineer, I want an analytical or numerical IK solver that computes joint angles for a target (X, Y, Z, Roll, Pitch, Yaw) in < 1ms.
acceptance_criteria: Returns closest solution to current pose

stories.title: IK solver rejects unreachable targets gracefully
stories.description: As an engineer, I want the IK solver to reject unreachable targets gracefully so the arm doesn't attempt impossible poses.

stories.title: 3D visualization of reachable workspace
stories.description: As an engineer, I want a visualization of the arm's reachable workspace so I can position objects within range.

epics.title: Path Planning
epics.description: Trajectory interpolation in joint and Cartesian space, collision avoidance, and real-time tracking loop.

stories.title: Trapezoidal velocity profile interpolation
stories.description: As an engineer, I want trapezoidal velocity profile interpolation in joint space so movements are smooth and respect velocity limits.
acceptance_criteria: Configurable max velocity and acceleration per joint

stories.title: Straight-line Cartesian end-effector paths
stories.description: As a user, I want the end-effector to move in a straight line in Cartesian space so the arm can follow a linear trajectory to the target.
acceptance_criteria: IK solved at each waypoint (>= 50 pts/sec)

stories.title: Self-collision checking during planned moves
stories.description: As an engineer, I want basic self-collision checking so the arm doesn't crash into itself during planned moves.

stories.title: Continuous real-time colored object tracking
stories.description: As a user, I want the arm to continuously follow a moving colored object in real-time so it tracks the ball smoothly.
acceptance_criteria: Smooth motion even with noisy detections

epics.title: Autonomous Ops & Demo
epics.description: End-to-end autonomous demos, monitoring dashboard, performance metrics, and final documentation.

stories.title: Autonomous pick-and-place of colored object
stories.description: As a user, I want the arm to autonomously pick up a colored object and place it at a target location so I can demo the full pipeline.
acceptance_criteria: Detects object -> plans path -> picks -> places

stories.title: RPi web dashboard with camera feed and IK overlay
stories.description: As a user, I want a web dashboard on the RPi showing camera feed, joint states, and IK target so I can monitor autonomous operation.

stories.title: Logged performance metrics and analysis notebook
stories.description: As an engineer, I want logged metrics (tracking error, loop timing, success rate) so I can benchmark and improve the system.
acceptance_criteria: CSV logging of key metrics per run
Dashboard or Jupyter notebook for analysis

stories.title: Full system documentation with demo videos
stories.description: As a contributor, I want full system documentation including vision pipeline, IK math, and demo videos so the project is presentable to investors or open-source community.

import_notes.jira: Use Jira CSV import: flatten stories from this JSON into rows with columns: Summary, Description, Issue Type, Epic Link, Priority, Story Points, Sprint, Labels, Acceptance Criteria. Map priority values: must_have->Highest, should_have->High, could_have->Medium.
import_notes.linear: Use Linear API bulk import. Map: key->identifier, title->title, description->description, story_points->estimate, labels->labelIds, sprint->cycleName, blocked_by->relations.
import_notes.azure_devops: Map: type=story->Work Item Type=User Story, epic->Feature parent, story_points->Story Points, sprint->Iteration Path, blocked_by->Predecessor links.
import_notes.trello: Create one list per sprint. Create cards from stories. Use labels for epics and phases. Checklists for acceptance criteria.
import_notes.github_projects: Use gh CLI: create items from stories, set custom fields for story_points/sprint/priority, convert acceptance_criteria to task lists in issue body.
